evidence.name: Tracking the Reliability of Information _ Datagotchi Labs.pdf

trends.name: As the world becomes more connected and more complex, it is increasingly difficult to know what to believe
Events happen far away from us, to other people, and we usually hear about them after the fact
Since we can no longer rely on many institutions, we will need to make sense of the world ourselves
Some information sources are more reliable than others
It's difficult to know which sources are reliable
We need to determine what sources we should trust
We may also want other ways to verify the truth of claims
We still need to share true information with others in a way that they can use it both immediately and in the future
A solution is needed to reliably create and share source trust data
A solution is needed to consistently evaluate the truth of claims
A solution is needed to use true claims to improve source trust data that will help them evaluate claims against the trustworthiness of the source
Overloaded by the news

evidence.name: There is no Developer Shortage. None of this crap really needs to exist _ by Kenneth Reilly _ Medium.pdf

trends.name: In the United States alone there are over one million “unfilled roles” in software engineering as of 2024 and the number is rising every year
There are many roles because of Unrealistic Expectations
There are many roles because of Manipulative Practices
There are many roles because of Overdigitalization of our lives
There are many roles because of employee burnout

We should seek meaningful work in other industries to build real products or fulfill legitimate service needs for others and actually see your work being completed and appreciated by employers and customers alike
Many of the open roles are not good fits for us
Existing talent can override knowing one specific technology or having a lot of experience in it
Hiring managers think that we need to have experience in their exact tech stacks
Hiring managers are rarely as talented as the people they are hiring (and that's the point)
Senior stakeholders abuse us for their own career growth/ego

evidence.name: Tech Companies Can’t Find Good Employees and It’s Their Own Fault _ by Joe Procopio _ Aug, 2024 _ Entrepreneurship Handbook.pdf

trends.name: Many tech companies have laid off techies to save money
Techies were the reasons tech companies succeeded
Many job listings posted on LInkedIn aren't real/available jobs
AI rejects resume out of hand
No one can wade through so many bad job applications
Junior employees/interns also reject resumes unreasonably
lack of capacity to be able to filter the technically elite from the barely literate
Increasing lack of participation in a hiring process
Even extremely talented and accomplished candidates have to jump through hoops to get a job
There are a large number of interview sessions
There are intelligence-insulting aptitude tests
There are requests to do actual work for the company as part of the interview
Companies need to hire techies to keep releasing their products well

evidence.name: Hard Core Programming is Dead. Software developers voted with their… _ by The Secret Developer _ Jun, 2024 _ Medium.pdf

trends.name: Software engineers value making quality software
Leaders of software engineers don't value quality software, just long hours
Software engineers & leaders have conflicting perspectives on software quality
Software engineers traditionally valued increased pay
Now software engineers are starting to value work-life balance
Continuous learning is essential for software engineers
Software engineers still seek new jobs for a pay raise
Software engineers are also looking for more fulfillment and better company culture
Since the pandemic, software engineers want to work from home more and have more control over their work
Companies are still trying to hire people to work long hours in their offices
Many people want to make impact at work
Many jobs deny software engineers from making impact
Many applications for new jobs are rejected due to not having impact at previous jobs
Technical interviews rarely filter out bad candidates, or even find good candidates
The world is changing: software engineers want more & hiring managers want to give less
Software engineers think they can find better jobs, so they are not held down by one company
Many software engineers can't get new jobs

evidence.name: Why Most Programmers Burn Out After the Age of 40 _ by Aleena _ Jul, 2024 _ Level Up Coding.pdf

trends.name: Working from home wasn't always an option
Many of us could work from home during the pandemic
Many companies want their employees back at the office
Many people still want to work from anywhere in the world and make good money
Most companies don’t allow employees to work from anywhere
You’re expected to attend pointless daily meetings every day
There are many approaches to writing software
Many software engineers have big egos
Rewriting someone else's code can conflict with their ego
The implementation of Agile at most companies is called Scrum
The reason Scrum is so popular is that it’s easy to understand, easy to implement, and easy to teach
One could argue that Scrum is an inflexible, rigid process
Software is supposed to be changeable
Many software engineers are assigned to on-call rotations, where they need to be prepared to handle urgent customer calls during weekends or at night
Software engineers are stressed
Changing requirements can stress people out
Technologies change very fast
Engineers need to stay aware of all of them, regardless of their quality
Many technologies that were fads are not used anymore
Most engineers over 40 are experiencing burnout
One option for engineers over 40 is to go into management
Another option for engineers over 40 is to keep job hopping to find something actually good
The third option for engineers over 40 is to try to treat it like a hobby again rather than a job
